item.title: Almost there, NZ! 39 essential things to know about alert level 3
item.description:
The countdown is well and truly on - there are only a few hours until we move from level 4 restrictions to level 3.
So what does that mean for you? What are we allowed to do? Read on!
Can I leave ...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202018/IMG_2066_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Lockdown rules are about to ease - so what are we allowed to do? Photo / File

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202016/A_050420NZHSURF5_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Police patrolling Piha on April 5 during the level 4 lockdown. Surfers defying the lockdown were issued tickets. Photo / Alex Burton

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202016/A_050420NZHSURF8_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Surfers are spoken to and issued tickets by the police at Piha beach on April 5 during lockdown. Photo / Alex Burton
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202016/A_130420NZHMMVIRUS12_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern. Photo / Pool

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202016/SCCZEN_A_120217WCBRCKFC01_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=You will be able to pick up a Zinger Burger or a snack box from KFC under alert level 3.
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202016/83855102_m_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=You will be able to go for a day tramp as long as it's easy and you can do it safely.

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202016/83421425_m_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Schools will be open in alert level 3 but attendance will be optional and you should keep your child distance learning at home if possible.
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202016/88451225_m_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Life will start to look a little more normal with some takeaway coffees back on the menu.

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202016/dontdrive_70x70.png?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Yes you can drive to the beach in alert level 3, but make it your local not your favourite on the other side of the North Island
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202016/132554975_m_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=How you might consider your alert level 3 bubble to look.

item.title: Kiwi expert's warning: Half of those infected with virus may not know it
item.description:
Up to half of people infected with Covid-19 might not even know it.
Dr Michael Baker, epidemiologist and professor of public health at the University of Otago, says we should assume that half of those ...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202018/98234532_l_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption='Some people have no symptoms at any time during their illness.' Photo / 123RF

item.nzh-sem:metakeywords: Coronavirus, Health, Politics, National, NZ Government
item.title: Eliminating Covid-19: Ardern's trailblazing mission that we may have already won
item.description: Key points • NZ is the only western country in the world with an articulated elimination strategy • PM say Covid-19 is effectively eliminated in NZ right now • That doesn't mean zero cases ...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202018/SCCZEN_270420NZHMMCOVID5_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said Covid-19 is effectively eliminated "currently" in New Zealand. Photo / Mark Mitchell

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202018/SCCZEN_A_130420SPLMichaelBaker_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Professor Michael Baker says New Zealand is the only western country to have an articulated strategy of eliminating Covid-19. Photo / Supplied

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202018/SCCZEN_310320ODTSKEGG1_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Epidemiologist Sir David Skegg says elimination means being able to forget about Covid-19 and having the protection of public health units. Photo / Otago Daily Times

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202018/SCCZEN_A_230715NZHGBSHAUN2_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Professor Shaun Hendy, director of the research centre Te Punaha Matatini, says it will be some time before we can say Covid-19 has been eliminated with more confidence. Photo / Greg Bowker

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202018/SCCZEN_270420NZHMMCOVID19_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Director General of Health Dr Ashley Bloomfield said elimination of Covid-19 has been achieved. Photo / Mark Mitchell

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202018/SCCZEN_GettyImages-1212297899_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern displays a graph showing how to flatten the curve during a press conference on March 14. Photo / Getty

item.title: A mates' trip to New York, a rugby team and a stag party - NZ's 16 Covid-19 clusters
item.description:
Do you know more about any of New Zealand's clusters? Email us.
Many of them are linked to big events, described as "a mixing bowl for infection" by the Ministry of Health.
There are two weddings ...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202018/A_2110NZHMSBARS1_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=One of New Zealand's cluster's is linked to a stag party. Photo / File
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202018/qtown_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=About 300 people were swabbed at a Queenstown supermarket. Photo / Matthew Mckew
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202017/wedidng_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=One of New Zealand's clusters stems from a wedding in Wellington. Photo / File

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202017/atawhai_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Atawhai Assisi Home & Hospital

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202017/chch_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=A team member at Christchurch compost company Living Earth tested positive for the disease on March 22.

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202017/A_150420SPLBernardPope_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Boxing coach Bernard Pope who died from Covid-19. Photo / Supplied
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202017/150420NZHDPMARGARET04_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=CHT St Margarets rest home on Te Atatu Peninsula. Photo / Dean Purcell
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202017/A_060420SPLRosewood_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Rosewood rest home in Christchurch. Photo / File
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202017/140420SPLChristos_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Chrisanthos (Christo) Tzanoudakis, 87, was the father of the groom.

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202017/A_260508NZHSRIDOME18_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Four hundred people from 18 countries attended the World Hereford Conference. Photo / File
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202017/A_300320NZHAGMATAMATA09_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=The Redoubt Bar in Matamata. Photo / Alan Gibson
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202017/wedding_70x71.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=The Bluff wedding cluster is New Zealand's largest. Photo / 123rf
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202017/A_010420SPLTAULU1_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Raechelle Taulu, principal of Marist College.
